title: Line model solve
description: Parameters for line model solve schema

useloglambdasampling.title: Wether to use log lambda sampling
useloglambdasampling.description: Only valid if jointly set with `continuumfit.fftprocessing=true`. Setting `fftprocessing` to True will loglambda rebin the input spectrum, which is then used to fit the template continuum using fft. We then have the choice to use the initial sampling (`useloglambdasampling=false`) or the rebinned one (`useloglambdasampling=true`).

linetypefilter.title: Filter on lines type
linetypefilter.description:
Restrictions on the type of line to fit: 
 * **E**: Emission 
 * **A**: Absorption 
 * **no**: fit all

lineforcefilter.title: Filter on lines force
lineforcefilter.description:
Restrict the strength category of lines to fit: 
 * **W**: Weak 
 * **S**: strong 
 * **no**: fit all

fittingmethod.title: Line fitting method
fittingmethod.description:
Line fitting method: 
 * **individual**: independant fit of all lines amplitude 
 * **svd**: joint fit of all lines amplitude (sparsity not exploited) 
 * **hybrid**: svd only for groups of lines sharings pixels (eg. Ha and N2), independant fit for the other lines 
 * **lbfgsb**: like hybrid but using non-linear least-square fit instead of svd to fit jointly the 3 Gaussian parameters (amplitude, position and width). Based on l-bfgs-b algorithm (bounded gradient descent). 
 Note: if `lineRatioType=tplratio`, choose "individual" (one set of ratio <-> a unique amplitude fitted for all lines).

linewidthtype.title: Line width type
linewidthtype.description:
Selects which component are included in the line width 
 * **instrumentdriven**: only instrument resolution (no intrinsic line width due to velocity dispersion) 
 * **velocitydriven**: only line velocity dispersion (assuming negligible instrument PSF) 
 * **combined**: both instrument resolution and velocity dispersion

velocityemission.title: Emission lines velocity
velocityemission.description: Unique non-fitted speed used in firstpass for linemodel solve. In km s-1. Used for `linewidthtype=combined` or `velocitydriven`

velocityabsorption.title: Absorption lines velocity
velocityabsorption.description: Unique non-fitted speed used in firstpass for linemodel solve. In km s-1. Used for `linewidthtype=combined` or `velocitydriven`

velocityfit.title: Wether to fit line width
velocityfit.discription: Wether 2nd pass includes line width fitting.

emvelocityfitmin.title: Emission lines velocity min
emvelocityfitmin.description: Tabulation of velocity for line width fitting in km s-1: minimal value for emission lines

emvelocityfitmax.title: Emission lines velocity max
emvelocityfitmax.description: Tabulation of velocity for line width fitting in km s-1: maximal value for emission lines

emvelocityfitstep.title: Emission lines velocity step
emvelocityfitstep.description: Tabulation of velocity for line width fitting in km s-1: step for emission lines

absvelocityfitmin.title: Aborption lines velocity min
absvelocityfitmin.description: Tabulation of velocity for line width fitting in km s-1: minimal value for absorption lines

absvelocityfitmax.title: Aborption lines velocity max
absvelocityfitmax.description: Tabulation of velocity for line width fitting in km s-1: maximal value for absorption lines

absvelocityfitstep.title: Aborption lines velocity step
absvelocityfitstep.description: Tabulation of velocity for line width fitting in km s-1: step for absorption lines

lbdaoffsetfit.title: Wether to fit wavelength offset
lbdaoffsetfit.description: Wether the 2nd pass includes lines wavelength offset fitting. Relevant only for `fittingmethod=svd`, `hybrid` or `lbfgsb`

ampoffsetfit.title: Wether to fit amplitude offset
ampoffsetfit.description: Wether the 2nd pass includes line's polynomial offset in the profile fitting. Relevant only for `fittingmethod=svd`, `hybrid` or `lbfgsb`

skipsecondpass.title: Skip second pass
skipsecondpass.description: Toggle the processing of a second pass refined around the candidates

extremacutprobathreshold.title: Extrema cut probability threshold
extremacutprobathreshold.description:
Selects the candidates to refine at the 2nd pass with a log probability (relative to max) upper than this threshold. 
 * **-1** means retain a fixed number (set from extremacount parameter) 
 * **any positive value**: retain all candidates with log(max(pdf))-log(pdf) values (not integrated) below this threshold. Moreover, the number of candidates in the output is forced to be less (or equal) than `linemodel.extremacount`.

lineRatioType.title: Line ratio type
lineRatioType.description:
* **rules**: fit all lines amplitude independently with eventually some constraints (see rules parameter below) 
 * **tplratio**: fit one amplitude with fixed line ratios coming from template-ratio catalogs 
 * **tplcorr**: after a linemodel "free", adjusts the best template ratio using the amplitudes vector as data, the global amplitude is the free parameter.

tplratio_ismfit.title: Wether to activate ISM extinction fit for lines ratio calculation.
tplratio_ismfit.description: Wether to activate fit of ISM extinction (ie ebv parameter from Calzetti profiles) on calibration lines to estimate lines ratio. Parameter scan from 0 to 0.9, step = 0.1. (best value stored in `FittedTplshapeIsmCoeff` in `LineModelSolve.linemodel_extrema.csv`).

continuumcomponent.title: Continuum processing method
continuumcomponent.description:
Selects the method for processing the continuum: 
 * **fromspectrum**: remove an estimated continuum (the continuum estmation is then tuned via continuumRemoval parameters). The redshift is thus only estimated from the lines 
 * **tplfit** : fit a set of redshifted template (aka "fullmodel" ie contiuum model + line model) 
 * **tplfitauto** : same than "tplfit", but switch to "fromspectrum" if the fitted continuum amplitude is found significantly negative (at all z)

continuumreestimation.title: Wether to re estimatate continuum
continuumreestimation.description:
* **no**: never 
 * **onlyextrema**: second pass 
 * **always**: both passes. Needs `continuumcomponent=fromspectrum`

stronglinesprior.title: Strong lines prior
stronglinesprior.description:
* **-1**: no prior 
 * **else**: use this value (positive below 1) as a low probability when no strong line is measured (the measured amplitude is s>0) & probability is set to 1 when a strong line is observed

euclidnhaemittersStrength.title: Pozetti N(z) prior
euclidnhaemittersStrength.description: Strength (beta) of the penalty. The chi2 penalty is -2 beta log(P(z)). No penalty for a negative or zero values

pdfcombination.title: Pdf combination method
pdfcombination.description:
At each z: 
 * **bestchi2**: select the max of the pdfs 
 * **marg**: marginalize the pdfs (over templates and all parameters)

nsigmasupport.title: Support size
nsigmasupport.description: Full (not half) size of each line support in sigma of the gaussian profile

haprior.title: Ha prior
haprior.description:
* **-1**: no prior 
 * **positive below 1**: low multiplicative prior probability (posterior penalization) when Ha line is not measured (the measured amplitude is <=0 or is not the strongest measured line) 
 * **else**: prior probability is set to 1 when Ha line is strongest measured line, typical value between 1e-1 to 1e-5

extremacountB.title: Extrema count B
extremacountB.description:
Number of extrema retained after the firstpass B: 
 * **0**: toggle OFF the firstpass B
 * **>0**: toggle ON the pass B

enablephotometry.title: Enable photometry
enablephotometry.description: Enable the use of photometry data

weight.title: Photometry weight
weight.description: The weight of photometry in the leastsquare sum relative to spectroscopy (factor to the photometry inverse variance, ie bigger than 1. gives more)

secondpasslcfittingmethod.title: Second pass continuum fitting method
secondpasslcfittingmethod.description:
During the 2nd pass, after fitting of all the parameters, redo a joint fit of continuum and linemodel amplitudes and eventually a 2nd order polynomial using an SVD on the full observed range (heavy computation). 
 * **-1**: skip this step 
 * **svdlcp2**: refit continuum, linemodel and 2nd order polynomial 
 * **svdlc**: refit only continuum and linemodel (usefull if we don't trust the continuum/linemodel orthogonalization, because it is done on a free linemodel or a mask)

margampcorr.title: Wether to apply analytic marginalization on amplitudes
margampcorr.description: Apply the analytic marginalization of the proba on the amplitudes
